page.title: 07ENVIRONMENT
page.content: AREA SOUTH OF WESTWOODSIDE ECOLOGY IN LITTLE BROOMSTONE AREA A COAL SEAM CAN BE LOCATED THREE OR FOUR FEET BELOW GROUND LEVEL. EXPERIMENTAL BORE HOLES FOR OIL RECENTLY LSUNK AT LANGHOLME. SEISMOLOGY TEST CARRIED OUT ON THE SITE OF LHAXEY GRANGE. THE FIELDS ARE BOUNDED BY DRAINS WHICH ARE KEPT IN GOOD REPAIR EITHE4 BY THE FARMERS THEMSELVES OR BY DRAINAGE BOARDS, WHO MAKE REGULAR INSPECTIONS. FOR THIS SERVICE THE FARMERS PAY APPROXIMATELY Â£3 _ Â£4 PER ACRE> WITH SUCH EFFICIENT DRAINAGE< THE WZATER LEVEL IN SOME PARTS HAS DROPED SO MUCH< THAT IRRIGATION HAS TO BE INSTIGATED. THE PEAT BOG AREA IN THE REGION OF HAXEY GRANGE HAS ALMOST DRIED UP. AT MISTERTON CARR FARM DRAINAGE HAS MADE A MOST VALUABLE AND REMUNERATIVE IMPROVEMEMT TO FARMING.
